question: Who became the first Indian bowler to take five-wicket haul with a pink ball?
explanation: Ishant Sharma has become the first Indian bowler to take five-wicket haul in the Day-night Pink ball Test against Bangladesh at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata. Earlier, Mohammad Nisar was the first-ever Indian bowler to take a five-wicket haul with the red ball against England at Lord\'s in 1932. Interestingly, current head-coach Ravi Shastri holds the record of first-ever five-wicket haul by an Indian with the white ball when he took 5-wickets against Australia at WACA in 1991.
